And your border shall turn from the south to the ascent of Akrabbim, and pass over to Zin, and its goings out shall be from the south of Kadesh-barnea; and it shall go out to Hazar-addar, and pass over to Azmon.
And the border shall turn from Azmon to the Brook of Egypt, and its limits shall be at the sea.
And as for the western border, the Great Sea shall be for you a border; this shall be your west border.
And this shall be your northern border: from the Great Sea you shall mark out for yourselves Mount Hor.
From Mount Hor you shall mark out to the entrance of Hamath, and the farthest reaches of the border shall be to Zedad.
And the border shall go out to Ziphron, and its end shall be at Hazar-enan. This shall be your northern border.
You shall mark out for yourselves the eastern border from Hazar-enan to Shepham.
And the border shall go down from Shepham to Riblah on the east of Ain, and the border shall go down and reach to the shoulder of the Sea of Kinnereth on the east.
And the border shall go down to the Jordan, and its end shall be at the Salt Sea. This shall be your land according to its borders all around.
And Moses commanded the children of Israel, saying, This is the land which you shall inherit by lot, which the LORD has commanded to give to the nine tribes and the half-tribe.

For the tribe of the sons of Reuben according to their fathers’ houses, and the tribe of the sons of Gad according to their fathers’ houses, and the half-tribe of Manasseh have taken their inheritance.
The two tribes and the half-tribe have taken their inheritance beyond the Jordan at Jericho eastward, toward the sunrise.
And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
These are the names of the men who shall apportion the land to you for an inheritance: Eleazar the priest and Joshua son of Nun.
And you shall take one leader, one leader from each tribe, to inherit the land.
And these are the names of the men: of the tribe of Judah, Caleb the son of Jephunneh.
And of the tribe of the sons of Simeon, Shemuel the son of Ammihud.
For the tribe of Benjamin, Elidad son of Chislon.
And for the tribe of the sons of Dan, the prince Bukki son of Jogli.
For the sons of Joseph, for the tribe of the sons of Manasseh, the prince Hanniel son of Ephod.
And for the tribe of the sons of Ephraim, a leader: Kemuel son of Shiphtan.
And for the tribe of the sons of Zebulun, the leader was Elizaphan son of Parnach.
And for the tribe of the sons of Issachar, a leader, Paltiel son of Azzan.
And for the tribe of the sons of Asher, a prince, Ahihud son of Shelomi.
And for the tribe of the sons of Naphtali, the prince Pedahel son of Ammihud.
These are they whom the LORD commanded to divide the inheritance to the children of Israel in the land of Canaan.
And the LORD spoke to Moses in the plains of Moab by the Jordan at Jericho, saying,

Command the children of Israel, that they give to the Levites from the inheritance of their possession cities to dwell in; and pasturelands for the cities round about them shall you give to the Levites.
And the cities shall be for them to dwell in, and their open lands shall be for their cattle, and for their goods, and for all their living things.
And the pasture lands of the cities which you shall give to the Levites shall be from the wall of the city and outward a thousand cubits all around.

You shall measure outside the city, on the east side two thousand cubits, and on the south side two thousand cubits, and on the west side two thousand cubits, and on the north side two thousand cubits, with the city in the midst; this shall be for them the pasture lands of the cities.
And the cities which you shall give to the Levites shall be the six cities of refuge, which you shall appoint for the manslayer to flee there; and in addition to them you shall give forty-two cities.
All the cities which you shall give to the Levites shall be forty-eight cities, them and their pasturelands.

And the cities which you shall give from the possession of the children of Israel, from the many you shall increase, and from the few you shall diminish; each man, according to his inheritance which they shall inherit, shall give from his cities to the Levites.
And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
Speak to the children of Israel and say to them, When you cross over the Jordan into the land of Canaan,
You shall appoint cities for yourselves; they shall be cities of refuge for you, and the manslayer who strikes down a life unintentionally shall flee there.
And the cities shall be for you a refuge from the avenger, so that the manslayer may not die until he stands before the congregation for judgment.
And the cities which you shall give shall be six cities of refuge for you.
You shall appoint three of the cities beyond the Jordan, and three of the cities you shall appoint in the land of Canaan; they shall be cities of refuge.
For the children of Israel, and for the stranger and for the sojourner among them, these six cities shall be for refuge, that anyone who strikes a person unintentionally may flee there.
But if he struck him with an instrument of iron so that he died, he is a murderer; the murderer shall surely be put to death.
And if with a stone in hand, by which one may die, he struck him and he died, he is a murderer; the murderer shall surely be put to death.
Or with a wooden tool in his hand, by which one may die, he struck him and he died; he is a murderer, the murderer shall surely be put to death.
The avenger of blood himself shall put the murderer to death; when he meets him, he himself shall put him to death.
But if he pushes him in hatred, or hurls something at him with premeditation, and he dies,
Or in enmity he struck him with his hand so that he died, he who struck shall surely be put to death; he is a murderer. The avenger of blood shall put the murderer to death when he meets him.
But if he pushed him suddenly without enmity, or hurled upon him any article without lying in wait,
or with any stone by which a man may die, without seeing, and it falls upon him and he dies, while he was not his enemy and was not seeking his harm.
And the congregation shall judge between the striker and between the avenger of blood according to these judgments.

And the congregation shall deliver the manslayer out of the hand of the avenger of blood, and the congregation shall restore him to the city of his refuge to which he had fled, and he shall dwell in it until the death of the high priest who was anointed with the holy oil.
But if the manslayer shall at all go out beyond the border of the city of his refuge, to which he has fled,
and the avenger of blood finds him outside the border of his city of refuge, and the avenger of blood kills the manslayer, he shall not be guilty of blood.
For in the city of his refuge he shall dwell until the death of the high priest, and after the death of the high priest the manslayer shall return to the land of his possession.
And these shall be for you a statute of judgment throughout your generations in all your dwellings.
Whoever strikes down a person, by the mouth of witnesses shall the murderer be put to death; but one witness shall not testify against a person to die.
And you shall take no ransom for the life of a murderer who is guilty of death, for he shall surely be put to death.
And you shall take no ransom for him that has fled to his city of refuge, that he should return to dwell in the land before the death of the priest.
You shall not pollute the land in which you are, for blood pollutes the land, and no atonement can be made for the land for the blood that is shed in it, except by the blood of the one who shed it.
And you shall not defile the land in which you dwell, in the midst of which I abide; for I, the LORD, dwell in the midst of the children of Israel.

Then drew near the heads of the fathers’ houses of the clan of the sons of Gilead, son of Machir, son of Manasseh, from the clans of the sons of Joseph, and they spoke before Moses and before the leaders, the heads of the fathers’ houses of the sons of Israel.

And they said, “My lord, the LORD commanded to give the land for an inheritance by lot to the sons of Israel, and my lord was commanded by the LORD to give the inheritance of Zelophehad our brother to his daughters.”

And if they become wives to one of the sons of the tribes of the children of Israel, then their inheritance will be taken away from the inheritance of our fathers and will be added to the inheritance of the tribe to which they shall belong; so it will be taken away from the lot of our inheritance.

And when the jubilee of the children of Israel comes, then their inheritance shall be added to the inheritance of the tribe to which they shall belong, and from the inheritance of the tribe of our fathers their inheritance shall be taken away.
And Moses commanded the children of Israel according to the word of the LORD, saying, The tribe of the sons of Joseph speak rightly.

This is the word which the LORD commands concerning the daughters of Zelophehad, saying, Let them be wives to whom it is good in their eyes; only to the family of the tribe of their father shall they be wives.
And no inheritance of the children of Israel shall turn from tribe to tribe, for each man of the children of Israel shall cling to the inheritance of the tribe of his fathers.

And every daughter who possesses an inheritance from the tribes of the sons of Israel shall be wife to one of the family of the tribe of her father, so that the sons of Israel may each possess the inheritance of his fathers.
And no inheritance shall turn from one tribe to another tribe, for each man shall cling to his own inheritance, the tribes of the sons of Israel.
As the LORD commanded Moses, so did the daughters of Zelophehad.
And Mahlah, Tirzah, and Hoglah, and Milcah, and Noah, the daughters of Zelophehad, became wives to the sons of their father’s brothers.
They were married into the families of the sons of Manasseh son of Joseph, and their inheritance remained with the tribe of the family of their father.
These are the commandments and the judgments which the LORD commanded by the hand of Moses to the children of Israel in the plains of Moab by the Jordan at Jericho.
